activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Rene Navarro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of  3 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. Absolute sobriety. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and/or schooling.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must comply and successfully complete drug treatment court. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due. Collections may include income assignment.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the co-defendant CYB and minor children. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

*AMENDED 03-31-22 No contact with codefendant, may have contact with child C.M at discretion of HSD.

**AMENDED 5/27/2022: Bond to comport with CHIPS conditions.**
